entry.def: An alder is a species of tree or shrub that grows especially in cool, damp places and loses its leaves in winter.

means.word_mean: 1. wood of any of various alder trees; resistant to underwater rot; used for bridges etc
2. north temperate shrubs or trees having toothed leaves and conelike fruit; bark is used in tanning and dyeing and the rot-resistant wood
